from sys_account
order by ${orderByClause}

update sys_account set topic_count_ = topic_count_+1, curr_version_ = curr_version_+1 where id_ = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT} and curr_version_ = #{curr_version,jdbcType=SMALLINT}
update sys_account set topic_count_ = topic_count_-1, curr_version_ = curr_version_+1 where id_ = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT} and curr_version_ = #{curr_version,jdbcType=SMALLINT}
update sys_account set entry_count_ = entry_count_+1, curr_version_ = curr_version_+1 where id_ = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT} and curr_version_ = #{curr_version,jdbcType=SMALLINT}
update sys_account set entry_count_ = entry_count_-1, curr_version_ = curr_version_+1 where id_ = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT} and curr_version_ = #{curr_version,jdbcType=SMALLINT}
update sys_account set entry_count_ = entry_count_-#{count,jdbcType=INTEGER}, curr_version_ = curr_version_+1 where id_ = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT} and curr_version_ = #{curr_version,jdbcType=SMALLINT}

update sys_account set islocked_=#{lock,jdbcType=CHAR} where id_ in
#{id}
mapper.select: select id_ id,user_name_ userName,account_name_ accountName,status_ status,nickname_ nickname,sex_ sex,mobile_ mobile, email_ email,vip_ vip,level_ level,fans_ fans,attention_ attention,topic_count_ topicCount,entry_count_ entryCount from sys_account where MATCH (user_name_,account_name_,nickname_,about_,desc_) AGAINST (#{word,jdbcType=VARCHAR} IN natural language MODE) limit #{first,jdbcType=INTEGER},#{limit,jdbcType=INTEGER}
select count(*) from sys_account where MATCH (user_name_,account_name_,nickname_,about_,desc_) AGAINST (#{word,jdbcType=VARCHAR} IN natural language MODE)
